name: Sufficiently Advanced Tech
description: Magic! In this set you'll learn to fly around in your pink pixie tutu while losing your sanity and draining skeletons of their blood.

quests.name: Entrance to the Arcane
quests.description: Thaumcraft: Where even the most logical man becomes a gibbering mess, and loves every second of it.

tasks.longDescription: Make an Iron Capped Wooden Wand and right click a bookshelf with it to get the Thaumonomicon, Thaumcraft's Guide Book. Some things may not be accurate, as Infinity Expert Mode changes some recipes.

quests.name: Flower Child
quests.description: The Lexica Botania, while innacurate in recipes, explains how Botania's mechanics work.

quests.name: Petals and Water
quests.description: The Petal Apothecary is how most Botanical flowers are created.

tasks.longDescription: The Petal Apothecary works same as allways, give it water and put the correct ingredients in, and then throw in Seeds. Interesting thing that many don't know, you can shift right click it with an empty hand while it's filled with water and you automatically put in the ingredients from the last thing you made.

quests.name: Life Through Flowers
quests.description: Some more of the mechanics added by Botania, mainly storing, moving, and using Mana.

tasks.longDescription: The Pure Daisy turns Stone into Livingrock and logs into Livingwood. These are very useful for crafting, and look quite nice for building.

Mana Spreaders are how you move Mana. Put it down, shift right click a Wand of the Forest in Bind Mode first on the Mana Spreader and then on the Mana Pool. Mana generating flowers bound to the Mana Spreader put the Mana in there, and then the Mana Spreader puts it into the Mana Pool, or whatever else it's pointed at.

The Mana Pool is arguably the most important thing made by Livingrock. It is used to store Mana, which many things from Botania use as energy. You can craft things with it by throwing the ingredient in.

The Runic Altar is another of the crafting mechanics Botania offers. It requires you point a Mana Spreader at it, and then you throw all the ingredients onto it. Once it's done filling up with Mana, throw a Livingrock on it and right click it with a Wand of the Forest.

quests.name: Crafting Like a Magician
quests.description: The Arcane Worktable is one of the ways Thaumcraft adds for crafting things. Some things require Essentia in your wand, which you get by holding right click on a Node. See your Basic Information tab of the Thaumonomicon for details.

tasks.longDescription: Right Click a Thaumcraft Table with a Wand to get the Arcane Worktable

quests.name: The Witches Oven
quests.description: The Witches Oven is how you get special Witchery Ingredients. Put Clay Jars in, some furnace fuel, and then saplings. Different saplings give different ingredients, as shown by NEI.

tasks.longDescription: The Witches Oven requires Arcane Worktable crafting and Mana Pool conversion to make.

quests.name: Nature's Magic
quests.description: The Witchery Altar gains Altar Power by having more nature stuff around it. You can also place stuff on top like a Wither Skull or a Candelabra. Check the wiki to see what is best.

quests.name: Blood for the Blood God
quests.description: The Blood Altar is probably the most important part of Blood Magic. This will eventually be a giant multiblock. At the largest tier, tier 6, it takes up a 23x23x9 space.

tasks.longDescription: I recommend checking the wiki and building the altar out of cobblestone, replacing it with what it actually needs as you get the blocks.
The Sacrificial Orb, when right clicked near a Blood Altar, removes a heart from your health and gives some Life Essence to the Altar.

quests.name: So Many Altars
quests.description: The final altar on the list, the Infusion Altar from Thaumcraft.

tasks.longDescription: See Infusion in the Artifice tab in your Thaumonomicon for more information on the Infusion Altar.

quests.name: Tea's On!
quests.description: The Kettle is used to craft similar to Thaumcraft's Crucible. Set a fire underneath it (preferably using Netherrack), give it some water, and throw in the ingredients. Be extremely careful that you put in the correct ingredients, as they cannot be gotten back if you make a mistake, and some recipes are incredibly complicated. If the Kettle starts emitting white swirls and making noises, the brew is ready to take out. Right click with an empty bottle to bottle it.

quests.name: Moonshine and Sunshine
quests.description: The Distillery is yet another crafting mechanic from Witchery. It uses Altar Power to function, so it must be placed near an Altar with sufficient Altar Power.

tasks.longDescription: Place Clay Jars in the bottom slot, and the 2 ingredients in the slots above. The results are put into the slots to the right.

quests.name: The World of Elves
quests.description: The Portal to Alfheim is a multiblock. It requires a pretty steady stream of Mana. The crafting recipe requires a tier 4 Blood Altar minimum.

tasks.description: Set up the Portal to Alfheim
tasks.longDescription: Right click on the Elven Gateway Core to activate the Portal. Throw in certain items in to get other certain items out. See NEI or the Lexica Botania for details.

quests.name: Stabbing the Earth
quests.description: The Guardian of Gaia fight gives pretty good drops, which are used in certain crafting recipes. To make the Gaia Pylons, you need at least a Tier 5 Blood Altar.

tasks.description: Set up Guardian of Gaia arena
tasks.longDescription: See the upgraded Lexica Botania for details on how to make the arena.

quests.name: ...orcloth Strapped Silv...
quests.description: The Ultimate. The Alpha. The best dang wand this modpack has to offer. 1000 Essentia Capacity, 70% vis cost, a name that is 52 characters long! What CAN'T this wand do?!

tasks.longDescription: To unlock Ichor research, you need to research ALL of regular Thaumcraft, and ALL non-Ichor related Thaumic Tinkerer research.

quests.name: I Can Make What Now?!
quests.description: You did it! You beat Infinity Evolved: Expert Mode! You now have the ultimate bragging rights.

tasks.longDescription: As one of the most powerful things available, this block has an INCREDIBLY hard recipe. It requires multiple very hard boss drops, every Botanical Rune, a fully charged Ichorium Adorned Ichorcloth Strapped Silverwood Wand, every Slate up to tier 5, and other stuff I guess. This block is an infinite source of Mana. Expect the infusion to last more than 20 minutes. Make ABSOLUTE SURE that your Infusion altar is as diddly-darn stable as it can be. Gaia Pylons are really good for stability.
